Text:
Very nice.
I already got the Carl Barks collection, now Don Rosa. Great.
One small thing: Why those dam .cbr and .cbz files?
[if you don't know how to use them: rename to .rar and extract, you 'll get a serie of images]
The Open Office word processor manages to save files as .pdf, I'm making a Carl Barks collection using the cbr/cbz files, and I plan to do the same with Don Rosa... but it could take some time, so grab these in the meantime, C.Barks is at http://thepiratebay.org/tor/3303609/Walt_Disney_Collection_-_Carl_Barks 

tips for downloading Crl Barks using the linked torrent: add http://tpb.tracker.thepiratebay.org/announce to the tracker list, the original torrent has only http://tracker.prq.to/announce , I got a 'couldn't connect to tracker' error until I added http://tpb.tracker.thepiratebay.org/announce

sorry, the torrent I used was http://thepiratebay.org/tor/3279071/Carl_Barks_Stories
do I want http://thepiratebay.org/tor/3303609/Walt_Disney_Collection_-_Carl_Barks too, or it's the same stuff?
OK I checked: it's the same stuff-
.cbr and .cbz files can be read by a comic book reader program, like CDisplay.
There is also many Carl Barks stories in this torrent.

Hey LucisFerens? Use CDisplay!
It's easy to use, and makes your reading experience so much better. Excellent upload, Scuttle

For a complete list of Don Rosa's comics (as .jpg), check this page: http://disneycomics.free.fr/Ducks/Rosa/index_stories_rosa.html 

Cheers.
